website_summaries.verdict: A low-priced, entry-level instrument that, for some professionals, offers a decent compromise between cost and quality.
pros: Includes non-chill coating and a five-year limited warranty
cons: Not as effective on smaller subjects (children and animals)

customer_reviews.title: This is a great stethoscope!
customer_reviews.text: I am an RN and I had been using my basic model Littman for 6 or 7 years until someone walked away with it on my unit. I replaced with this one since I didn't want to spend a bunch of money again. It's lighter and I hear JUST AS CLEARLY with this one if not even more clearly. This is a great stethoscope!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: It's a toy?!?
customer_reviews.text: I order this black stethoscope but got a blue non related one instead I have uploaded pictures because words cant describe what I got...Not even the same manufacturer it looks like a toy...I am just like...wow😒🤔
customer_reviews.author: NotJustMum

customer_reviews.title: What I do have an issue with on this as opposed to my Classic III is that it lets in a lot more ambient sound which isn't the best while working in the back of an ambulance
customer_reviews.text: This is lighter than my Littmann, it's also louder than my Littmann which I was surprised about. What I do have an issue with on this as opposed to my Classic III is that it lets in a lot more ambient sound which isn't the best while working in the back of an ambulance. I also find the ear tips to be less comfortable than the Littmann, but for the price, I would much rather purchase a bunch of these and break them rather than lose my Littmann. I also got the opinion of my nurse friend and he echoed my views on this stethoscope.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product/Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I have bought and used Littman stethoscopes for the last twenty plus years. Recently mine found a new owner :) Based on the reviews and being close to the end of my career I decided to try this brand. I love it. You hear heart and breath sounds very clearly. I also like the different look, it's completely black from ear tips to bell. Excellent product for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Bennett

customer_reviews.title: It ain't a Littmann
customer_reviews.text: Well I finally lost my Littmann after 1 year. I second guess my Blood pressure readings because it's not quiet as clear. I don't hear the Korotkoff sounds clear like a Littman but I hear something at the right Mark when I double check with my parnters littmann. This would be good to toss in 1st aid bags cuz it works and it is very light weight. But for daily use I stand by LITTMANN.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, cheap and it works. Save your money and buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: Lightest stethoscope ever. I've had 2 littmans previously that both sprouted legs. The littmans were definitely nicer but only by maybe 10%. This scope more than makes up for that in its price and its weight. It's almost weightless both in my pocket and on my neck. And I can still hear everything I need, plus it looks like it cost way more than it did. I'm very happy and will only be buying this one from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Annulusofzen

customer_reviews.title: Cannot hear ANYTHING
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this stethoscope because I used a pretty cheap one during clinicals at school. The one I used in school works great but I wanted something a little more professional looking for my first RN job. It looks like I’ll be sticking with old reliable because this stethoscope is awful, good thing I tried it at home first. I cannot hear a thing, but with my old one you hear everything. I don’t know if mine is just defective because I see a lot of positive reviews. Just a plain waste of my money.
customer_reviews.author: VicJay

customer_reviews.title: Great stethoscope great price to boot
customer_reviews.text: Take a risk on getting this rather than buying a traditional stethoscope brand and I’m pleasantly surprised. Sounds good, options are great quality is very good. I would recommend any medical professional or healthcare professional eating a stethoscope or even gamers wanted to listen to the baby or adults box
customer_reviews.author: Nikip

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love this scope, I don’t know what people are talking about that they can’t here with this thing. I’m a paramedic and work in the back of an ambulance all day. The reviews that say it lets in to much noise are just wrong , that has more to do with the ear cups. It was good before I upgraded the cups, now it’s a great scope.
customer_reviews.author: Justin S.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing scope, I recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Great price and good quality. Needed a new stethoscope but didn’t wanna spend $100+ on a Litmen. I lost my previous ADC ADScope and I loved it. Honestly for what I use it for it serves more then it’s purpose. Clearly hear lung sounds, hear beats, bowel sounds, epigastric sounds and can easily and effectively take blood pressures.
customer_reviews.author: StormTech

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, truly awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Have another color of this scope and wanted a backup to keep on hand, decided to try the newer version. Absolutely one of the best values Ive seen and definitely the most comfortable/lightest design. Sound seems as good if not better than my older one. Love it and recommend to anyone who asks.
customer_reviews.author: mommaflash

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, really really AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this 4 years ago when I was a PCT. Flash forward, now I'm an RN. I've been using a Littman Classic 3, but it's the one I had all through school, and has sentimental value, so I want to get a cheaper one that's less likely to "walk away". While packing to move, I found this one and.... WOW! I think the sound quality is just as good if not BETTER than my Littman. I'm ordering another one!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING STETHOSCOPE AT ANY PRICE.
customer_reviews.text: WOW!! Best stethoscope for the money! Hands down. I am a respiratory therapist & I have difficulty hearing. With this stethoscope I hear perfectly clear! Also, it is so light I often forget it’s even around my neck. The price makes this UNBEATABLE! ...PERIOD
customer_reviews.author: mikeybooboo

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The stethoscope looks great sound is good for the price definetely light appears pretty durable only had about a week. The ear pieces were a complaint from a lot of people theyre a little firm and I could see them breaking after time but they fit well in my ears and are not uncomfortable. My hopes were a lot higher from reading reviews but its definetely worth the money and I would definetely buy again and recommend
customer_reviews.author: Bryana Christian

customer_reviews.title: Great For The Money
customer_reviews.text: These are clearly not high end ears but I have had these for 8 years and they have held up well. I work in the fire service as a CEP and use these on every shift. I feel i'm able to hear lung sounds pretty well with these. For the money I'd purchase these again. They look good too.
customer_reviews.author: Drew R. Kroger

customer_reviews.title: Lasted through nursing school and beyond.
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this to use in clinicals in nursing school. I've been a nurse for 2 years now and I'm still using it. It works fantastically well, the sound is excellent and- bonus- it looks *so cool*. I love the all black! And for a "budget" priced stethoscope this is a total score. If I had borrowed it from someone and been asked to guess the price I would have guessed twice as much, easy. Worth every penny and probably many more. A very good investment, especially for a nursing student. Just get this one. ;)
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a CMA and have used this stethoscope for almost 2 years now. Very good quality, just be sure you turn the bell the right way. Some wear in the metal part near the ears but that's just because I'm a little rough with it and I'm using it twice as often now as a Nursing Student.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Juarez

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a floor nurse on a med surg floor. I just use this for assessments and checking here and there for these types of pts. Suits the job just fine. I can hear murmurs, heart and lung sounds, crackles, all that jazz. It's very light and flexible. I barely notice it on my neck and can fit into scrub pockets. For the price? Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Lester

customer_reviews.title: and this one works just as good. The earpieces don't swivel around (only can put ...
customer_reviews.text: Had several other classmates that purchased more expensive ones, and this one works just as good. The earpieces don't swivel around (only can put them on one way) as some of my friends, but honestly for the cost I could care less. Just need to make sure I am putting them on right in the first place, not a big deal at all. Would recommend to anyone that might need a good stethoscope for a good price. I only use these maybe once a month, so not much wear and tear yet. I will post if anything changes, but I don't foresee this happening. They are built just like some of the more expensive ones my classmates have. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: ngrady

customer_reviews.title: ADC 609>Cardiology 3
customer_reviews.text: I am a Paramedic and use this daily. This is my second ADC 609 and I love them. Great sound quality. I have two top brand competitors and I prefer the sound and light weight design of these hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan L. Martin

customer_reviews.title: What an excellent stethoscope for the price
customer_reviews.text: What an excellent stethoscope for the price!! As a nurse, I have had many stethoscopes. While working in the emergency department, I have had some of my stethoscopes "go missing" or wrecked. With a price like this, it is a stethoscope that I am comfortable wearing to work, that is also a quality worth purchasing. Its very lightweight and comfortable for wear. The tubing is about 3 inches too long for my tastes, so I trimmed it. Now its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: It DOES NOT work & CANNOT be returned
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy these! Aside from the discomfort in my ears from squeezing a normal sized head; they don’t even work. Between 2 nurses & myself, only one could barely hear my hear. I am thin, with no fat & little boob to try hearing through. Had I realized they had a no return policy I wouldn’t have bought it. It was a total disappointment & waste of money. I can’t even donate them because they don’t work. A box of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli N. Whithorn

customer_reviews.title: Good Stethoscope for General Use
customer_reviews.text: It seems adequate for home use. I have no idea how it compares to a professional version.
customer_reviews.author: EasyTBear

customer_reviews.title: Works just as well as most of the better brands the school has
customer_reviews.text: Bought for nursing school. Works just as well as most of the better brands the school has. They have a different model that's a little more expensive and is made of heavier material that has less external artifact noise a class mate has. This is perfect if you are looking for quality enough to get you through school, and cheap enough that you won't have a heart attack if you lose it. Keep the extra ear pieces safe, after a year or so a few of my classmates who bought this brand needed one.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the novice or experienced nurse.
customer_reviews.text: You are not likely to get a better stethoscope for the money. Well balanced around the neck. Good sound quality. Seems durable. Was inexpensive. Not costly enough to be concerned about losing, but works well enough to feel very confident in your assessments.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin R. Riddick Jr.

customer_reviews.title: The lightweight design is great as this product easily fits into a coat pocket
customer_reviews.text: The lightweight design is great as this product easily fits into a coat pocket. To reduce weight, the tube is thinner than many stethoscopes and predictably that impacts sound delivery. Still, it's adequate for auscultating lungs and picking up louder murmurs plus the diaphragm tends to stay a comfortable temperature. A reasonable backup/travel scope for light usage.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Christoph

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad to start
customer_reviews.text: Not too bad for the price. Not a littman but does the job if your a nursing student and just started. Wouldn’t recommend using this once you start rotations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It is a cheaper ADC stethoscope, I had a better one before but this is a cheaper replacement. It's well made, the diaphragm feels a bit cheap but it transfers sound well enough. The whole thing is quite light weight, which I like.
customer_reviews.author: sangster

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as a Littman
customer_reviews.text: My Littman few apart after nearly 30 years & needed a need one, the cost at the time was out of reach. The sound quality was no where near as good as a Littman.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice stethoscope
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for work. Might not want it in black, it may walk off with a co worker.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Upton

customer_reviews.title: best steth for money
customer_reviews.text: i was looking for cheaper one than Littmann, I work long hours and risk for losing one. going by positive reviews I bought this - easily best steth for money, lightweight great sound, value cant be beat, just buy this without qualms highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Rakesh HS

customer_reviews.title: Dont Do It Girl!
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a piece of crap. I would NOTrecommend anyone with a license to risk using this stethoscope. I was on a cardiac floor and I could not hear a single apical heart rate, lung sounds, or BP on any of the clients. I could hear bowel sounds but those aren't a crucial as HEART AND LUNG SOUNDS!!! I ended up using the flimsy stethoscope in the omnicell which was 100X better.
customer_reviews.author: Kassidy Singh

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable but functional.
customer_reviews.text: Uncomfortable but functional. What it lacks in sound clarity it makes up in sound volume. 4 stars for it's value at that low price
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is very good quality for the price. I have used a lot of stethoscopes and unfortunately have a tendency to lose them. I like to leave them around and they eventually find a new home. Most recently I lost a classic Littmann Classic II S.E., which is a decent stethoscope for what it is, and this is similar in quality in my opinion. Is this the cardiology 3? No, but then again most things a stethoscope is used for do not require that level of a stethoscope. I will probably buy this exact one again once I lose it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great stethoscope for the price.
customer_reviews.text: 29 years in healthcare and I have bought and used just about every stethoscope out there. I wish I had found this one years ago. Light long incredible acoustics and is tough as nails and showing nowhere and tear in the front pocket of my backpack I carry around. I won't be buying any other type of stethoscope again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S

customer_reviews.title: Probably better for others but not for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for nursing school and it worked great until I was in a room with a bunch of people talking. It looks and feels great and no body thought it was a cheapo. I ended up getting a digital one, it may not of been this stethoscopes fault, I'm a veteran and was exposed to some super loud stuff I may be hard hearing.
customer_reviews.author: Kody Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Cheap stethoscope
customer_reviews.text: Bought from Amazon, ears hurt , sound stinks. Can't return for some stupid reason.
customer_reviews.author: Medic

customer_reviews.title: Met my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a medical professional so I can't compare to other units. Just to be able to listen to heart and lung condition of my wife is exactly what I needed. Works wonderfully. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A. Knies

customer_reviews.title: The best scope you can get for less than 70 bucks.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time I've bought this scope, not because it stops working, but because I always lose them. I'm an FNP in the inpatient setting, and it's perfect for what I do. I used to have a basic Littman (which I lost), and this scope is way better. I'm hard of hearing and have no problems with this scope. I can pick up grade 2 murmurs on it.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: The only difference seems that littmanns are better at drowning out outside noise however you should be ...
customer_reviews.text: This stethoscope is very high quality. I'm very hard of hearing due to shooting guns and playing drums but this stethoscope has been just as proven as my friends littmann I used in nursing school. The only difference seems that littmanns are better at drowning out outside noise however you should be able to hear what you need to hear with this pair. Don't bother with that prestige crap, buy three of these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I have used this stethoscope for the past couple of months in nursing school and it works fine. I feel that I can hear the same sounds as others. I probably will upgrade when I finish school but this is a great product for anyone still in school or someone that doesn't completely rely on a stethoscope for their work.
customer_reviews.author: Ismael

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this stethoscope. It gets the job done perfectly. Sound quality is great, better than the “other” big name brand in my opinion. Will be my go to brand from now on for stethoscope purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time OR money
customer_reviews.text: I had to give it one star because I wasn’t able to give it no stars. Stethoscope does look nice but you can’t hear anything. You can barely hear the pulse for blood pressure. Forget the lung sounds...hear nothing. When I tapped the chess piece it sounded fine. Don’t know what the problem is. Don’t waste your money. I was able to return it though.
customer_reviews.author: wanda p

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money
customer_reviews.text: I love the length of the stethoscope and how light weight it is. I have used the Lipman for years and I don’t notice any difference in quality between the stethoscope and the ones are used prior
customer_reviews.author: Crystal K. Adair

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Low price but good,simple functioning dual head stethoscope for day to day work. I had an issue with the plastic ring holding the plastic diaphragm in pace cracking and it could not be replaced. Otherwise, durable
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Returns not accepted;  product not good
customer_reviews.text: Can’t hear anything. Purchased a few days ago and am told CANNOT BE RETURNED. Save your money and get a scope that works!!!
customer_reviews.author: A. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: A little better than the cheapest
customer_reviews.text: Overall seems like an upgrade to the cheep stethoscopes available but ADC is known to make quality products and the diaphragm on this stethoscope is very flimsy. It does come with a spare.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement stethoscope for work and was not impressed. The sound quality is poor and the material feels cheap. There is no indicator whether you are using the side of the diaphragm or bell, other than putting the earpiece in and tapping the diaphragm. The only advantage to this stethoscope is that it is lightweight and slightly smaller in comparison to others. If you are looking for a quality stethoscope but don't want to pay the higher price for a Littmann, definitely go with Prestige Clinical Lite instead of this one!
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Good stethoscope, better than what you'll get to borrow
customer_reviews.text: Started a VN program and needed a stethoscope for lab and clinical's. Works just fine, I've used it for taking manual blood pressures, listening to lung and heart sounds without any issue. During school you don't need a super expensive stethoscope, especially since you'll be doing really basic stuff for a while.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an EMT student to practice listening to lung sounds. I was very disappointed when I could barely hear perfectly clear healthy lung sounds in many volunteers. I had my Paramedic instructor listen with this stethoscope as well and they too could not hear anything. I was told a good stethoscope is priceless therefore I will be ordering a LITTMANN.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Of the best scopes I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I am an EMT for the FDNY and I have been through many scopes prior to getting this. I ordered this product and it came the very next day which was surprising. Six months later this is still what I use in the field. Other products I've had in the past, pieces has broken off. Like the ear pieces, etc. This product is very durable, fashionable. I'm not hesitant to go in my bag in the middle of a trauma call and wonder if my scope is still in one piece.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ortiz Jr

customer_reviews.title: product is borderline fine
customer_reviews.text: The stethoscope is just fine. Heart Sounds r very well audible but breath sounds are on the weak side. However the Bell is very weak when it comes to hearing. If you want a cheap affordable stethoscope but not concerned about the quality of the sounds then this is the one you need to buy otherwise invest elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: drcuddles

customer_reviews.title: Useful in a pinch but bad for use by beginners.....
customer_reviews.text: Got this stethoscope as an emergency filler after I lost my more expensive cardiac stethoscope in the wards. It is a lightweight, easily foldable stethoscope that is passable for medical use if you have a lot of experience and know what you are looking for. You do sacrifice a lot in terms of acoustics with this steth so I find myself really straining to listen carefully whenever I am using it. If you are new to your practice and not that experienced then I suggest using a more acoustically sensitive stethoscope. Needless to say this steth now remains in the glove compartment again as an emergency backup.
customer_reviews.author: junior 5

customer_reviews.title: I’m a paramedic and use this. It works well ...
customer_reviews.text: I’m a paramedic and use this. It works well and is durable enough to have survived an ambulance for 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha venditto

customer_reviews.title: Good, inexpensive scope.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable ear pieces. I am able to easily hear blood pressure readings. Nice that it comes with an extra diaphragm and set of ear pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Diane P.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: Works great for everyday use. Very lightweight, you would hear what you need to as a nurse. The longer tubing is weird though and rubs against surfaces while you're listening, which 1. may collect bacteria 2. add unwanted sounds. You can cut the tubing to a desired size though. I got used to it so I wont be cutting anything. Very comparable to the littmann lightweight in terms of sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Handm612

customer_reviews.title: Not a littman, still fantastic quality.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic. The scope is light, flexible. The tubing is very malleable. Great acoustics as well, can hear breath sounds and monitor BP while moving in the truck perfectly. Would highly recommend this scope.
customer_reviews.author: Chef

customer_reviews.title: Impressive sound for little $
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised of quality at such an affordable price!! Other nurses u work with were impressed as well and several have purchased their own..
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Use the right way and no problems.
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use at home on my children so not a seasoned stethoscope user but ear pieces must be inserted the right way to hear. At first I had them in backwards and was hearing absolutely nothing and thought they were junk and didn't work but when I turned them around they worked and I could hear everything perfectly clear.
customer_reviews.author: Chad L.

customer_reviews.title: Great value, diminishing returns with more expensive stethoscopes
customer_reviews.text: This has great acoustic acuity for practically all but the most specialized tasks. See my title as I think there is very little gained benefit with more expensive stethoscopes.
customer_reviews.author: Sami Narayanan

customer_reviews.title: great sound, lightweight, long tubing, amazing value
customer_reviews.text: Impressive sound quality, and best value I've found. People borrow it, and they don't want to give it back.
customer_reviews.author: B21

customer_reviews.title: No Complaints
customer_reviews.text: I'm in my last year of nursing school and purchased this stethoscope for clinicals. I needed something that could be used on adults and pediatrics. The acoustics are just as good as my littman. It is very lightweight; you can hardly tell you're wearing it. I've had my littman for about 7 years and I really just wanted a stealth colored stethoscope because I think they look cool and I rarely see anyone with them. I'll post an update in the spring as far as durability.
customer_reviews.author: Nashville RN

customer_reviews.title: missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I only gave it 3 stars because it is missing the extra pair Adsoft Plus eartips and the name tag. otherwise it is good and would have given it 5 stars.this one its the 609
customer_reviews.author: jg

customer_reviews.title: Decent as a back up or for prominate sounds only.
customer_reviews.text: It works. I needed a back up and didn't want to spend a ton to get one. It is just that. If you need to listen for lung sounds they better be prominate, of your listening to cardio beyond "that sounds normal" look else where.
customer_reviews.author: Skr15

customer_reviews.title: Ready to go once it’s delivered
customer_reviews.text: Very simple design and works well in a hospital setting. I would buy a higher end product for noisier areas (ambulance, pre hospital scene) but for paramedic hospital clinicals it’s a great buy and was very useful to me. Love all the color options and no assembly required. Comes with extra ear plugs and bell drum.
customer_reviews.author: Leigha

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for nursing students and lifelong nurses alike
customer_reviews.text: This review is based strictly on the fact that this stethoscope is possibly the best value on the market. It may not be a 5 STAR stethoscope in terms of perfect quality and sound cancellation, but it can certainly compete with Littmann's across the board. I've handed this stethoscope to 3 or 4 nurses on my unit and told them the price (under $20) and they agree in it's quality. I'd highly recommend this to any nursing major, PA, or nurse that does minimal to moderate jobs involving a stethoscope. However, if you use your stethoscope in a louder setting, or you use it on a cardiac / telemetry floor, I may suggest a better quality stethoscope. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: You hardly hear anything out of your heart, no matter how you try to hear it. I think"what you pay is what you get" is true for this poor quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Iwai

customer_reviews.title: EMT - Great Stethoscope
customer_reviews.text: Another EMT review here. I use this on the ambulance pretty often and due to it's cheap price it usually lives in my cargo pocket on duty. It's sturdy and has lasted over 6 months now with no issue. It's just as good as a lower end Littman. No problem with road noise while the rig is in motion. Looks just as good as an expensive stethoscope too. Like I said...it lives in my Cargo pocket...and I have no concerns. If it breaks or if I lose it....I can afford to buy another one....and I would. I'd recommend it to anyone in EMS or Fire looking for a good stethoscope.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle B.

customer_reviews.title: Works great even in back of ambulance. For price no big deal if lost or ruined.
customer_reviews.text: Got while an EMT student -works great even while in the back of the ambulance. For the price wasn't too worried about it getting lost or ruined. It's held up great so far.
customer_reviews.author: N3rdWife

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for price
customer_reviews.text: For the price it’s a pretty good stethoscope! I’m a CMA and I really use it for blood pressure but the sound is nice and clear!
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing....
customer_reviews.text: This is very nice looking stethoscope. But that is all it is. I have been a nurse for almost 14 years and this is definately the worst stethoscope i have ever used. I could barely hear ANYTHING out of it. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Cristy Green

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner, and this is great to me. Light weight, look professional. Hope can carry it and head to my course.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Mhee...
customer_reviews.text: Should be enough if you're looking for low quality sound during auscultation of any sound emitted by the human body. However, if you truly wish to have a superb physical I would suggest another stethoscope. This device is good for a quick exam. Meticulous users should use other more soffisticated equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo Wunderlich

customer_reviews.title: Feather weight!!! Affordable!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my BNA class! I am so in love with it. With a very good feel for the material! And super, the feather like weight!!! I feel so impressed with it!!! High recommended! Affordable price! Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.author: Heleb87

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was good. This stethoscope is definitely better than those cheap-o ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast. Packaging was good. This stethoscope is definitely better than those cheap-o models. The tubing is bigger and I like the "Y" connection. I often have a nurse say "Quick! Let me borrow your stethoscope!". I don't like lending out an expensive Littmann, so this ADC will do just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria J.

customer_reviews.title: Love this brand
customer_reviews.text: GREAT value for the price. I bought two of them after my Littman tubing broke. Will never buy Littman again! :) Love love love this brand now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: This is the best stethoscope I have ever owned!! Perfect sound quality. Super lightweight. Will never try another kind again!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome scope for one third of the price of a Littman. I am a Respiratory Therapist and use it almost daily and the sound quality equals my Littman.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy Pacheco

customer_reviews.title: ADC > Littmann... for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Very good. My only complaint is the metal tubing is light and makes an AWFUL scraping sound when they're rubbed together but that is a stretch for an actual complaint. They're clear and loud. They may be a notch below Littmann's in material quality but a much better bang-for-your-buck if it isn't being used all day and every day.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great value for students
customer_reviews.text: Great stethoscope for the price. I bought it to use for an EMT class and I didn’t want to buy a pricier one. Though once I did finish class the upgrade was definitely worth it and necessary. Just not loud enough for ambulances or loud work environments.
customer_reviews.author: r louie

customer_reviews.title: Great, light weight stethoscope that's reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: Great, light weight stethoscope that's reasonably priced. This is my second ADC stethoscope and it has great acoustics in comparison to other more highly priced stethoscopes. Also, the shipping for my item was ridiculously fast. I live in LA and chose regular shipping and it got to me the next day. Extremely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Francis B

customer_reviews.title: and was pleasantly surprised at how great it is
customer_reviews.text: I got this stethoscope as something temporary while my litman tubing was being replaced, and was pleasantly surprised at how great it is! I use this now more than my other one because it's also lighter around my neck!
customer_reviews.author: Sara U.

customer_reviews.title: I bought 2
customer_reviews.text: This stethoscope is great! I even bought 2, one for each car, so I never forget it. I work on an ambulance and we usually take manual BP, I never have a problem finding the heart beat with this stethoscope. Also breath sounds are very easy to hear, as well as heart tones. Plus the all black is nice. I get compliments all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Walton

customer_reviews.title: I can hear breath sounds better with this stethoscope than I could with my $300 ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Littmann Cardiology III with this stethoscope and I am beyond thrilled. The price is unbeatable and it is very lightweight. I can hear breath sounds better with this stethoscope than I could with my $300 Cardiology III. Highly recommended by a Respiratory Therapist.
customer_reviews.author: G Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great scope for your money!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite (of the three I own!) by far. It is super light weight and has wonderful sound. I cannot really compare it to a Littmann as I've only "played" with one outside of a clinical setting, but it seemed pretty comparable to me. This poor thing has seen me through two semesters of nursing school, and will easily get me through my final semester and preceptorship I am sure.
customer_reviews.author: froggychk

customer_reviews.title: Love It!
customer_reviews.text: During my CNA program, I purchased a really cheap one that came with a blood pressure cuff. Big mistake because I could not hear anything! For my nursing program, I knew I had to buy a professional stethoscope. I did my research before purchasing this. It works wonderful and you have a 5-year manufacturer warranty. You can hear clearly and easily. You won't regret buying this. All the best!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I was surprised at how lightweight and how well I ...
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how lightweight and how well I could hear with this, my cardiac stethoscope years ago is heavy and I paid much much more for it.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: I definitely wouldn't recommend this for anyone who deals with a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight, but the sound quality is very mediocre. I should have expected that because of the price. I don't think I'd get one again... Littmans may cost a little more but they're worth it (and I just work in a trauma ICU, I definitely wouldn't recommend this for anyone who deals with a lot of cardiac/respiratory issues).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stylish like a Littman
customer_reviews.text: Very sensitive and definitely can hear heart and lung sounds. I've gotten so many compliments about this Stethoscope. Other nurses have asked where I've brought this, and I have reffered them every time to ADC!
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Working well for checking bloodpressure
customer_reviews.text: These could be more comfortable in my ears. Quite a bit of pressure and I would not want to wear it more than a minute or so. I have no idea if this is a professional quality device, but it works perfectly fine for taking blood pressure and that is all I will ever use it for. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Southplank

customer_reviews.title: An excellent scope at an excellent price.
customer_reviews.text: As a physician for over 30 years, I have used many different stethoscopes. This is as good as any them at an incredibly low price. Sound quality is excellent.The tubing is soft and flexible, unlike the usual cheap scopes. I highly recommend, especially if you are prone to losing your stethoscope.
customer_reviews.author: Woodchuck

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a good product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my significant other to use in his met class. It works pretty good and wasn't too expensive.
customer_reviews.author: DeeShena

customer_reviews.title: ... and this one works just as well if not better. I've owned this for over a year now
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a Lithman Cardiology stethoscope for 4 years and this one works just as well if not better. I've owned this for over a year now. The only thing that may be a negative is the ear piece came off in my book bag and disappeared. They do not sell ear piece replacements. I think I found them on sale once, but it was cheaper to get a new stethoscope altogether. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: One side doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: This is very lightweight..which I LOVE, but only one side works, I deaf in my right ear and I have to 'thump' it to see if I can hear it, if I can't, I flip the earpeliece around and then I can. Very disappointing for a new stethoscope! I didnt use it when first got it, so it is too latexto send back or I would.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: First one I ordered didn't work at all. The replacement doesn't work very well
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I love my stethoscope ❤️💕 I use this at work every day! Perfect sound, light weight, and durable
customer_reviews.author: SandiJ

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money, and get a higher quality one
customer_reviews.text: I've had this about 5 months, and the bell isn't working anymore. Thought I was losing my hearing so I had my husband try it. He confirmed it. Will try to get back in touch with the company to return.
customer_reviews.author: Cici1dog3cats

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Great for heart sounds, but not as good with breath sounds as compared to the Littman Classic iii.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Works just as well as my Littman but no one ...
customer_reviews.text: Works just as well as my Littman but no one steals this one and it was half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Buy for a great stethoscope
customer_reviews.text: OMG just as good as the littmann cardiology and very light weight. Ear tips are soft.
customer_reviews.author: 4evervegan

product_meta.title: ADC Adscope Lite 609 Ultra Lightweight Clinician Stethoscope, 31 inch Length, Tactical Black - 609ST
product_meta.description: Color:Tactical Black| Style:Adscope Lite 609 - Old VersionThe Adscope-lite 609ST is the only affordably priced stethoscope to combine superior acoustic response with an ultra lightweight design
feature_bullets: Combination chestpiece is precisely machined to exacting tolerances from lightweight aluminum. Highly sensitive, non-chill diaphragm for greater amplification and crisper high-frequency transmission; extra-large, non-chill bell for low-frequency response.

Clinician headset features reinforcing yoke molded into flexible 22-inch PVC tubing, lightweight aluminum binaurals in matching satin finish, and Adsoft Plus silicone eartips for the ultimate in wearing comfort and acoustic seal.
Includes spare diaphragm and one additional pair of Adsoft Plus eartips
Five-year warranty and free "consumables," including diaphragms and eartips, when registered.
